column4: if it's stopped working in both Ubuntu & Windows, that strongly suggests you've had some kind of hardware failure. If it's under warranty, I'd return it. If it's not, I'd buy a plugin wireless card...
any suggestions to see if it is a hardware problem?
normally I'd say exactly what you've done: try windows vs. Ubuntu. Since it's stopped working in both, that sort of rules out being a software problem...
you really need to say something happier than that.... i'll try windows again....
